Desetine hiljada Libanaca protestovalo u Bejrutu protiv vlade

03 Nov 2019, 19:55

BEJRUT, 3.novembra (Beta-AP) Desetine hiljada Libanaca protestovalo je danas protiv vlade u centralnom Bejrutu. To su najveće takve demonstracije otkako su pristalice ekstremističkog Hezbolaha prošle sedmice rušile i palile šatore koje su demonstranti postavili. Današnjim demonstracijama prethodio je mnogo manji miting hiljada ljudi nekoliko sati ranije u znak podrške predsedniku i ministru spoljnih poslova Libana koji su dve glavne mete antivladinih protesta započetih 17. oktobra. Demonstranti su danas pozvali da se sutra održi opšti štrajk i da se ubrza politička tranzicija nakon ostavke premijera Saada Haririja prošle nedelje. Oni pozivaju na sveobuhvatne promene političkog sistema osnovanog nakon gradjanskog rata koji je trajao od 1975. do 1990. godine. Predsednik Mišel Aun i njegov zet ministar spoljnih poslova Gebran Bazil i drugi politički lideri su odbili zahteve demonstranata da podnesu ostavke. Aun i Bazil su članovi hrišćanske partije u savezu sa proiranskim Hezbolahom koji optužuje strane sile da manipulišu protestima. Stotine pristalica Hezbolaha su upale su na glavno mesto protesta u utorak, a Hariri je nekoliko sati kasnije podneo ostavku.

Tens of thousands of Lebanese protested in Beirut against the government

03 Nov 2019, 18:55

BEIRUT, Nov 3 (Beta-AP) Tens of thousands of Lebanese protested against a government in central Beirut today. These are the largest such demonstrations since supporters of extremist Hezbollah demolished and torched tents erected by protesters last week. Today's demonstration was preceded by a much smaller rally of thousands of people hours earlier in support of the president and foreign minister of Lebanon, two of the main targets of anti-government protests launched on October 17th. Demonstrators today called for a general strike to take place tomorrow and to accelerate political transition following the resignation of Prime Minister Saad Hariri last week. They call for comprehensive changes to the political system established after the civil war that lasted from 1975 to 1990. President Michel Aun and his son-in-law, Foreign Minister Gebran Basil, and other political leaders have rejected protesters' requests to resign. Aun and Basil are members of a Christian party in alliance with pro-Iranian Hezbollah, which accuses foreign powers of manipulating protests. Hundreds of Hezbollah supporters stormed the main protest site on Tuesday, and Hariri resigned hours later.
